etymologies: late Middle English: from Old French moleine, of Celtic origin; compare with Breton melen, Cornish and Welsh melyn ‘yellow’

definitions: a herbaceous plant of the figwort family with woolly leaves and tall spikes of yellow flowers, native to Eurasia but now widely and commonly distributed.

notes.text: Genus Verbascum, family Scrophulariaceae: several species, in particular the widespread common mullein or great mullein (V. thapsus)

shortDefinitions: herbaceous Eurasian plant with woolly leaves and tall spikes of yellow flowers
